modules.description: The module offers operations for constructing, modifying, and querying maps with string keys and arbitrary values, including insertion, deletion, lookup, and iteration. It supports sequence-based data manipulation, functional transformations like folding and filtering, and conversions between maps and lists/sequences, ideal for tasks such as configuration handling or structured data processing.

Provides functions for manipulating lists, including filtering, mapping, and concatenating elements with custom predicates and transformations. Works with polymorphic list types and ensures efficient traversal and memory usage. Used to process log entries by category and generate aggregated summaries from raw data streams.

Provides functions to retrieve a version string and a SHA hash associated with the build. Operates on internal build metadata stored as strings. Used to embed build information into binaries for debugging and deployment tracking.

Processes character streams into token streams using customizable keyword sets, skipping whitespace, newlines, and nested comments. Identifies identifiers and special characters, returning them as tokens or raising errors for unrecognized symbols. Converts strings to integers using a dedicated parsing function.

provides a set of map operations for string-keyed data structures, enabling insertion, deletion, lookup, and iteration with support for functional transformations and conversions. It handles structured data through sequence manipulations and is suited for configuration management. Custom print functions ensure proper formatting of numeric values, addressing specific output requirements. Examples include building configuration tables, filtering key-value pairs, and converting maps to lists for further processing.

Generates stubs for virtual nodes based on provided configurations, using a boolean flag to control boot behavior. It operates on lists of tuples representing virtual node connections. Used to automate the creation of initialization code for distributed systems.

Provides functions to configure and control a plotting interface, including setting terminal types, window sizes, step ranges, and visibility of variables. Operates with reference types for mutable state and string-based configurations. Used to load resource files, manage dynamic plotting, and generate output channels for real-time data visualization.

Reads input definitions and values from a channel, parsing structured data including variable names and types, and handles debug labeling. Writes formatted output, including variable interfaces and computed results, using custom formatting functions. Processes input lines, supports termination on "q", and manages substitution lists for dynamic value replacement.

Provides functions to convert values and types to strings, including custom formatting for floats and handling of type aliases. Works with complex data structures like access paths, substitutions, and type-value mappings. Used to manipulate and serialize data structures in a domain-specific language context.
